title: Traffic Control/Security Guard
description:
**About SSPTMS:**

Sam Schwartz Pedestrian Traffic Management Services, Inc. (SSPTMS) is on a mission to inspire hope, power, and potential! Founded in 2014 by the famous “Gridlock Sam” and headquartered in NYC, SSPTMS is a pioneer in elite traffic management solutions throughout the United States and is ever-expanding.

SSPTMS provides unique traffic management programs and personnel to address the specific needs faced by businesses. Industries we serve include airports, cranes and construction, event venues, neighborhood and community organizations, distribution centers, and schools.

Apply to work with us today if you:

* Are looking for a fresh start.
* Like physical activity and working outside.
* Have keen observation skills and want to keep everyone safe.
* Are dependable and hardworking.
* Enjoy the responsibility of being in control.
* Like the idea of an extended weekend.
* Take medical and retirement benefits seriously.
* Want every day to be a new adventure.
* Want a job that will become your career.

**Job Description and Schedule:**

We are seeking personnel to work as Traffic Managers at JFK International Airport in Queens, New York. A description of the Traffic Manager role is as follows:

* Understand and apply safe traffic control practices.
* Actively manage and ensure the continuous flow of traffic.
* Continually monitor traffic, report conditions and operational impact.
* Maintain free-flowing lanes of traffic where needed.
* Keep pedestrian crosswalks clear of stopped or standing vehicles.
* Prevent the “staging” of vehicles; direct any stopped or standing vehicle to leave the area.
* Prevent, report, and coordinate the removal of unattended vehicles.
* Report unusual activity, hustler activity, and homeless activity.
* Assist others with directions and other information about activity in the area.
* Receive and communicate instructions and information clearly, firmly, and courteously.
* Watch for known unsafe behaviors and changing traffic and weather conditions.
* Uphold the policies and standards of SSPTMS and our client.

The following schedule options are available at JFK IAT Terminal 4 ONLY: **Working part of the weekend (Saturday or Sunday) is essential!**

* **OPTION 1:** 7am to 3pm
* **OPTION 2:** 2:30pm to 11pm
* **OPTION 3:** 11pm to 7am

**Job Requirements:**

**Licenses and Certifications:**

* NYS Unarmed Security Guard License - Required for Hire to work at JFK IAT terminal 4.
* Flagger Certification (4hr) - Required Within 30 Days.
* First Aid/CPR/AED Certifications - Required Within 90 Days.
* *OSHA-30 and SST are also preferred but are not required.*

**Education and Experience:**

* A high school diploma, GED or equivalent is required.
* At least one (1) year of airport/terminal operations knowledge and experience is preferred.
* At least one (1) year of flagging, traffic management, airport security, and/or other safety related experience is preferred.

**Uniform:**

* We supply your hat, pin, t-shirt, vest, sweatshirt, winter jacket, raincoat (provided at the job site to use while working) , whistle, radio, and lighted baton.
* You must provide your own pants and footwear in accordance with our uniform and appearance guidelines.

**Other:**

* **Please be punctual and dependable.**
* Assignments are outside and we work in all weather conditions including wind, rain, and snow.
* You must agree to complete all training and credentialing requirements for work on the project.
* You must have a smartphone with cellular service.
* **You must be able to manage stressful situations, like challenging and uncooperative individuals in an unauthorized area, while keeping a professional attitude and demeanor.**
* Please have a happy, caring, and positive attitude - customer service is important!
* Strong communication skills, including radio communication skills, are required.
* You must be trustworthy and ensure confidentiality when necessary.
* Please be clean and professional in your appearance.
* You must be able to stand and walk for upward of 8 hours per day.

**Job Benefits:** (\\*offered to all eligible employees within 90 days of hire).

* Medical and Prescription Benefits\\*
* Dental Benefits\\*
* Vision Benefits\\*
* Life Insurance Benefits\\*
* Short- and Long-Term Disability Benefits\\*
* 401(k) Retirement Benefits (may enroll after six months / 1,000 hours worked)
* Paid Sick and Safe Leave (may begin to accrue/use immediately)

**Our Commitment to an Inclusive Workplace:**

SSPTMS is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We celebrate the unique differences of our employees which drive curiosity, innovation, and the success of our business. We proudly employ employees from all walks of life. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy, parental status, genetic information, political affiliation, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law. Accommodation may be available for applicants with disabilities.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $17.00 - $22.50 per hour

Expected hours: 25 – 40 per week

Benefits:

Schedule:

Application Question(s):

* Are you able and willing to work outside? All work is preformed outdoors. We work in all weather conditions.
* Which shift(s) are you available to work (7am to 3pm), (3pm to 11pm) or (11pm to 7am)?

Experience:

title: Boiler Technician
description:
**About us**

We are professional and agile.

Our work environment includes

* Growth opportunities

\\*\\*Job Summary:\\*\\*

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Boiler Technician to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for the installation, maintenance, and repair of boilers and other related equipment. The successful applicant will possess a strong background in industrial maintenance and have a keen understanding of industrial mechanics. This role requires a high level of technical expertise, and excellent customer service skills.

\\*\\*Duties:\\*\\*

- Troubleshoot and diagnose problems with boiler systems, including electrical, mechanical, and hydraulic issues.

- Perform repairs and replacements of boiler components, including pumps, valves, and gauges.

- Install new boilers and related equipment, ensuring proper installation and setup.

- Read and interpret schematics and blueprints to identify and correct issues.

- Maintain accurate records of work performed, including maintenance schedules and repair histories.

- Provide excellent customer service, responding to customer inquiries and addressing concerns in a timely and professional manner.

- Collaborate with other maintenance technicians to ensure efficient and effective maintenance operations.

\\*\\*Experience:\\*\\*

- 2+ years of experience in industrial maintenance or a related field.

- Proven experience in the installation, maintenance, and repair of boilers and HVAC/R systems.

- Strong background in industrial mechanics and hydraulics.

- Familiarity with schematics and blueprints.

- Experience with customer service and communication.

- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision.

- Physical stamina to perform manual labor and lift heavy equipment.

This role is an excellent opportunity for an experienced Boiler Technician to join a dynamic team and work on a variety of industrial maintenance projects. If you have a passion for mechanical systems and a strong work ethic, we encourage you to apply.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $34.00 - $38.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus opportunities
* Commission pay
* Signing bonus
* Tips

Application Question(s):

* Do you have your own vehicle?

Experience:

* Boiler mechanic repairs and trouble shoot: 2 years (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Brooklyn, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: On the road

title: Wait Staff - Hiring Server
description:
We are looking for a competent **Restaurant Server/Waitstaff** to take and deliver orders. You’ll be the face of our restaurant and responsible for our customers’ experiences. Food server responsibilities include ensuring our tables are clean and tidy when guests arrive, presenting menus and serving food and beverages. You need to be quick on your feet (literally and metaphorically) and have a polite and friendly attitude. If you enjoy talking to people and thrive in a fast-paced workplace, we’d like to meet you. Your ultimate goal will be to provide high-quality service that will help us maintain and attract customers.

Responsibilities

* Prepare restaurant tables with special attention to sanitation and order
* Attend to and welcome customers upon entrance
* Present restaurant menus and help customers select food/beverages
* Take and serve orders
* Answer questions or make recommendations
* Collaborate with other restaurant servers and kitchen staff
* Deal with complaints or problems with a positive attitude
* Use a POS system to submit orders, issue bills and accept payment
* Clear and clean all dining and work areas (tables, chairs, counter, bathroom, floors, storefront)
* Enforce and abide by restaurant COVID policies

Skills

* Proven restaurant serving or waitering experience preferred
* Hands-on experience in cashier duties
* Attention to cleanliness and safety
* Patience and customer-oriented approach
* Excellent people skills with a friendly attitude
* Responsible and trustworthy
* Able to work under pressure and fast-paced environment

\\*\\* Need to be able to work nights

We are open from 12PM - 11PM everyday. Must be able to file taxes.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $16.00 - $17.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule

Shift:

* Day shift
* Night shift

Ability to Commute:

* Long Island City, NY 11101 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Sales Specialist, Private Markets Indices
description:
**About the Role:**  

**Grade Level (for internal use):** 11
  
**The role :** Sales Specialist - Private Markets Indices
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

Execute the regional sales strategy to achieve annual sales and revenue targets for private markets indices and associated index data.
  
Collaborate with account-based sales and client segment specialist teams to penetrate and grow index revenues in their named accounts.
  
Serve as a subject matter expert across GPs, LPs, asset managers, investment banks, insurance, and other financial institutions with ability to articulate product strategies, positioning and rationale, performance drivers, etc.
  
Develop deep expertise with S&P DJI’s products as well as continually educate oneself and Commercial teams to maintain strong product knowledge of the full suite of available and developing Indices, their integration points with other Indices products, and competitors
  
  

**Sales & Business Development:**  

Joint responsibility in partnership with the regional client coverage teams for the sale and retention of private markets index offerings in the region
  
Serve as an architect, providing guidance to help form a holistic suite of Indices for clients (the blending of managed strategies), based on S&P DJI’s market views but customized according to client preference
  
Collaborate across different product and sales teams to deliver the right suite of solutions for each client
  
Work closely with regional client coverage teams to drive new investment flows and retain existing businesses, evaluating flow trends across regions and pivoting focus accordingly
  
Participate in regional cross-functional/cross-team pod meetings weekly, quarterly, and annually
  
Leverage product, market, and technical expertise to build and maintain credibility with clients, identify gaps, and recommend solutions; and deliver on revenue-generating goals
  
Shared accountability for achieving revenue and market share growth targets
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

2+ years of successful track record in a sales or relationship management, managing your own accounts and a minimum of 5 years’ experience in a commercial role. Experience of private markets products or solutions is beneficial.
  
Bachelor’s degree required.
  
Industry knowledge of index solutions and invest management.
  
Results driven – owns partnerships as key enablers to deliver business objectives.
  
Strong consultative sales approach and capabilities; experience in solutions selling
  
Ability to drive growth through proven sales results, from prospecting to pitching to closing
  
Ability to stay on top of evolving market trends with desire to continually learn and add new technical and selling skills.
  
Effectively operate in a highly team-oriented and collaborative environment
  
Strong presentation, strategic thinking, interpersonal, negotiation and closing skills
  
  

**Critical Experiences:**  

B2B financial services and sales experience with established history of revenue generation
  
Experience with contracts, commercials, and fee proposals
  
Multi-tasker, rapid thinker and globally minded professional with proven capabilities to collaborate within a sales team to deliver
  
Demonstrated ability to educate colleagues and clients and drive sales outcomes
  
Experience achieving results through influence and cross-functional collaboration internally and externally
  
Experience engaging with a range of players across organizations from Sales to Product Managers, etc.
  
Proven ability to work efficiently in a collaborative selling environment while maximizing resources available to achieve success.
  
  

Flexible Working
  
We pride ourselves on our agility and diversity, and we welcome requests to work flexibly. For most roles, flexible hours and/or an element of remote working are usually possible. Please talk to us at interview about the type of arrangement that is best for you. We will always try to be adaptable wherever we can.
  
  

Return to Work
  
Have you taken time out for caring responsibilities and are now looking to return to work? As part of our Return to Work initiative (link to career site page when available), we are encouraging enthusiastic and talented returners to apply, and will actively support your return to the workplace.
  
  

**Compensation/Benefits Information (US Applicants Only):**  

S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $100,000 to $135,000. Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location. In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for additional compensation such as a semi-annual incentive bonus plan.
  
This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires.
  
  

sentials.com/newhires.
  
  

About S&P Global Dow Jones Indic e s
  
At S&P Dow Jones Indices, we provide iconic and innovative index solutions backed by unparalleled expertise across the asset-class spectrum. By bringing transparency to the global capital markets, we empower investors everywhere to make decisions with conviction. We’re the largest global resource for index-based concepts, data and research, and home to iconic financial market indicators, such as the S&P 500 ® and the Dow Jones Industrial Average ® . More assets are invested in products based upon our indices than any other index provider in the world. With over USD 7.4 trillion in passively managed assets linked to our indices and over USD 11.3 trillion benchmarked to our indices, our solutions are widely considered indispensable in tracking market performance, evaluating portfolios and developing investment strategies.
  
**S&P Dow Jones Indices is a division of S&P Global (NYSE:** SPGI). S&P Global is the world’s foremost provider of credit ratings, benchmarks, analytics and workflow solutions in the global capital, commodity and automotive markets. With every one of our offerings, we help many of the world’s leading organizations navigate the economic landscape so they can plan for tomorrow, today. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/spdji .
  
  

What’s In It For You?
  
  

**Our Purpose:**  

Progress is not a self-starter. It requires a catalyst to be set in motion. Information, imagination, people, technology–the right combination can unlock possibility and change the world.
  
  

Our world is in transition and getting more complex by the day. We push past expected observations and seek out new levels of understanding so that we can help companies, governments and individuals make an impact on tomorrow. At S&P Global we transform data into Essential Intelligence®, pinpointing risks and opening possibilities. We Accelerate Progress.
  
  

**Our People:**  

We're more than 35,000 strong worldwide—so we're able to understand nuances while having a broad perspective. Our team is driven by curiosity and a shared belief that Essential Intelligence can help build a more prosperous future for us all.
  
  

From finding new ways to measure sustainability to analyzing energy transition across the supply chain to building workflow solutions that make it easy to tap into insight and apply it. We are changing the way people see things and empowering them to make an impact on the world we live in. We’re committed to a more equitable future and to helping our customers find new, sustainable ways of doing business. We’re constantly seeking new solutions that have progress in mind. Join us and help create the critical insights that truly make a difference.
  
  

**Our Values:**  

Integrity, Discovery, Partnership
  
  

At S&P Global, we focus on Powering Global Markets. Throughout our history, the world's leading organizations have relied on us for the Essential Intelligence they need to make confident decisions about the road ahead. We start with a foundation of integrity in all we do, bring a spirit of discovery to our work, and collaborate in close partnership with each other and our customers to achieve shared goals.
  
  

**Benefits:**  

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
  
  

**Our benefits include:**  

**Health & Wellness:** Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
  
  

**Flexible Downtime:** Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
  
  

**Continuous Learning:** Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
  
  

**Invest in Your Future:** Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
  
  

**Family Friendly Perks:** It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
  
  

**Beyond the Basics:** From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.
  
**For more information on benefits by country visit:** https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
  
  

**Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at S&P Global:**  

At S&P Global, we believe diversity fuels creative insights, equity unlocks opportunity, and inclusion drives growth and innovation – Powering Global Markets. Our commitment centers on our global workforce, ensuring that our people are empowered to bring their whole selves to work. It doesn’t stop there, we strive to better reflect and serve the communities in which we live and work, and advocate for greater opportunity for all.
  
  

-----------------------------------------------------------
  
  

Equal Opportunity Employer
  
S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
  
  

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.

title: Director, Product Management
description:
**About the Role:**  

**Grade Level (for internal use):** 13
  
  

**The Team:** The Enterprise Solutions business within S&P Global Market intelligence provides buy-side, sell-side, and corporate clients with industry-leading software, data and services. The business portfolio offers a broad range of product offerings covering enterprise data management, investment management, loans platforms, regulatory and compliance solutions, and private markets solutions.
  
  

Our Reg & Compliance ecosystem us comprised of products that complex regulatory, client lifecycle management, and compliance requirements.
  
  

**Client Lifecycle:** Provides automated and configurable solutions to centralize end-to-end client lifecycle processes for brokers, custodians, corporates, fund admins, buy sides, investors, and service providers.
  
  

**Regulatory Solutions:** Suite of solutions helping market participants to make regulatory elections, declarations, and securely permission regulatory information to their trading counterparties.
  
  

**Documentation Solutions:** Helping clients to manage all aspects of the documentation lifecycle, from creation to data extraction and utilization of that data to increase process automation.
  
  

**Reference Data:** Suite of solutions empowering clients to collect and manage suitability certificates seamlessly and overcome complex client lifecycle processes.
  
  

**Outreach 360:** Platform designed to tackle the intricate challenges of client outreach and communication essential for regulatory updates, client lifecycle events, due-diligence, and data gathering.
  
  

**Managed Services:** Assist clients with scalability challenges, the ability to utilize our Data, Technology, and services to manage complex regulatory engagements .
  
  

**Responsibilities & Impact:**  

**Product Strategy and Vision:**  

Translates multi-year strategy into actionable in-year execution, integrating an entity-level perspective by building and operating through business areas and processes beyond direct remit.
  
  

Plans resource allocation to achieve technical and business objectives, secures stakeholder alignment to the solution roadmap at all levels, and ensures the roadmap is forward-looking and easily updatable to stay current in an evolving market.
  
  

**Product Execution and Delivery:**  

Leads comprehensive analyses of requirements for new or modified products to define underlying business drivers.
  
  

Ensures successful completion of all tasks and deliverables in the requirement analysis and mapping stage, supervises advanced use of analysis tools and services, and prioritizes findings to identify key requirements and objectives.
  
  

Prioritizes features based on customer impact and development time.
  
  

**Stakeholder Management and Influence:**  

Builds relationships throughout the project lifecycle, initiating early engagement for stakeholder buy-in.
  
  

Facilitates procedures to improve communications and supports implementation of communication plans to keep stakeholders informed.
  
  

Serves as a subject matter resource, providing advice to teams and key client stakeholders.
  
  

**Customer Insight :**  

Leads customer research and innovation activities.
  
  

Leads research into new business partners.
  
  

Compensation/Benefits Information (This section is only applicable to US candidates):
  
S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $121,757 to $213,964.25. Final base salary for this role will be based on the individual’s geographic location, as well as experience level, skill set, training, licenses and certifications.
  
  

In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan.
  
  

This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, please click here .
  
  

**What We’re Looking For:****Basic Required Qualifications:**  

Significant experience from a market-leading enterprise software vendor of front-office solutions
  
  

Experience in Client Lifecycle Solutions highly preferred
  
  

Experience leading high-performing global teams, including the ability to foster collaboration, facilitate teamwork, and influence internal stakeholders outside of your reporting lines
  
  

Adept at building and maintaining trusted and credible relationships with clients and colleagues at all levels
  
  

Strong organizational, problem-solving, and planning skills
  
  

A strong collaborator who enjoys being the bridge between engineering, product, and internal stakeholders
  
  

Ability to understand and communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  
  

Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to work effectively across departments and levels of the organization.
  
  

Proven experience providing roadmaps, product overviews, reports, backlog, and documentation for enterprise technology solutions
  
  

Proven experience of modern software development methodologies and practices (SDLC, Agile, Scrum, etc.), and tools
  
  

Engaging and credible presence, particularly at executive levels
  
  

Bachelor’s Degree
  
  

Talented returners to apply, and will actively support your return to the workplace.
  
  

**Return to Work:**  

Have you taken time out for caring responsibilities and are now looking to return to work? As part of our Return to Work initiative, Restart, we are encouraging enthusiastic and talented returners to apply, and will actively support your return to the workplace.

title: Creative Movement Instructor
description:
**CREA Interactivity is** seeking enthusiastic and experienced instructors to lead unique interactive and immersive physical activity programs for elementary school-aged children designed to get them to move.

**Job Description**

* Playfully instructing children through CREA’s adventures and creating a playful, positive and motivating atmosphere based on teamwork
* Promoting a mix of drop-in experiences, afterschool programs, camps, birthday parties and special events.
* Ensuring a safe, supportive and organized environment while calmly directing groups of children.

**Job Requirements**

Have a strong background in teaching and a passion for engaging young learners in active, fun, and educational activities. **Must feel comfortable and able to instruct hour-long physical activity with children.**

Previous experience working with elementary aged children and a background in early childhood education as it relates to dance, gymnastics, physical education or camp counseling or, related fields is preferred

title: Front Desk Associate (Weekends REQUIRED)
description:
**Please do not contact the store regarding your application, we will reach out to you for an interview if we feel that we are a good match.**

The Rage Cage is a unique place for people to have fun and relieve stress by smashing things! You will be responsible for guiding guests through the experience from beginning until end. You will also be in charge of responding to questions and dealing with appointments in-person, through email, or on the phone. We like to keep a relaxed environment but many times we do get busy and you will have to juggle multiple interactions at once.

We are looking for someone who:

* Is a people person and loves interacting with people from all different backgrounds
* Is comfortable managing multiple groups of people (sometimes more than 10 guests at once!)
* Can think on the fly and can keep clients on schedule
* Can juggle multiple tasks at once in a busy environment
* Is comfortable with basic math
* Is reliable and punctual
* Is comfortable setting up and managing appointments for guests
* Is OK with light cleaning (dusting and sweeping) throughout the day

Your main duties include:

* Greeting and checking in clients for their appointments
* Guiding clients through our safety process and going through rules
* Answering general client inquiries through in-person, phone, and email interactions
* Keeping the front area tidy and assisting with clean up if necessary
* Cleaning and disinfecting safety equipment after use

**This job is for**

**Tuesdays and Thursdays from 2:15-9:15pm as well as Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays 12:15-9:15pm, you MUST have this availability.**

Starting pay is $16 with a paid 30-45 minute lunch break. After a probationary period of 1-3 months your pay will increase based on performance and duties. You will also receive a portion of all tips from guests depending on the hours you've worked for the month (this is usually about $30-$90 a month).

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $16.00 - $17.00 per hour

Shift:

* 8 hour shift

Application Question(s):

* What days and hours are you available to work every week?

Work Location: In person

title: QA Analyst
description:
**What we are looking for**



Mobot is seeking a tech-savvy and detail-oriented doer to help us build best-in-class operations for quality assurance. You may have built your own app or recently finished code bootcamp and want to break into software development. Maybe you've worked in tech retail, Quality Assurance, technical support. Maybe you are a gamer with an eye for detail. No matter your background, you are a team player who is comfortable delivering high quality results in an incredibly dynamic environment.



This role is **in-person** in NYC. Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States.


**The role**



Quality Assurance (QA) Analysts are on the front lines of Mobot - ensuring we find and report bugs to our customers so that they can improve their apps. As an QA Analyst at Mobot, you will execute tests, analyze results, and report observations to our customers. You will also be an important front-end voice for our team, working cross-functionally with Customer Success and Engineering, as we improve our internal products. To be successful in this role, you must be exceptionally detail-oriented, customer-centric, and a great problem solver.


**If you are hustling to break into tech but aren't sure how - you love technology, have an uncanny eye for detail, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we think this role might be right for you.**


**Responsibilities**



We are a small but mighty team where everyone wears many hats. This is a dynamic role, and responsibilities will evolve as you grow with Mobot. Key responsibilities include (but may not be limited to):


* Perform and oversee manual tests for multiple mobile applications
* Collaborate with internal team members to address incoming customer requests
* Document your findings from testing via written text and video captures
* Assist the Customer Success team with investigations focused on mobile app bugs discovered during testing
* Plan and execute automated mobile application testing with mechanical robots
* Attend daily stand up meetings and document processes


**About you**


* Detail-oriented - you have a deep attention to detail. You probably found a typo or formatting error in this job posting. Our customers rely on us to observe nuanced issues in their mobile apps and provide detailed context
* Tech-savvy - you have strong knowledge and experience with computers and smartphones. We test on various iOS/Android phones & tablets. We also use MacBooks.
* Time management - you are able to efficiently manage multiple customer requests while delivering in a timely manner
* Excellent communicator - you can clearly articulate your ideas through verbal and written mediums to teammates
* Logical and critical thinker - you can quickly get up to speed and think on your feet
* The boring stuff - you are proficient with modern productivity software - Google Suite, slack, etc.


**Bonus points**


* Startup experience - there are many different types of dynamic and fast-paced environments, but we think startup experience is unique. You thrive in this environment and have experience balancing multiple, sometimes competing priorities
* Quality Assurance background - you have prior experience as a Quality Assurance Tester or similar role
* Passionate about robots!


**Compensation & benefits**


* Competitive compensation
* Generous PTO, including 1 week company-wide winter break
* 401k with company match
* Stock options
* Comprehensive health benefits
* Paid family leave
* Commuter benefits
* Much more!


**Salary**



Mobot is committed to delivering competitive and equitable pay for our employees. The expected base pay range for this position is $60,000 - $70,000/year. However, the base pay offered may vary depending on multiple factors, including the candidate's relevant skills, experience, and location. Mobot's total rewards package also includes performance bonuses, our comprehensive benefits and equity program, and PTO.


**How to Apply**  

Does this role sound like a good fit? Interested candidates should submit a resume.



We may be a robotics & automation business - but rest assured **we read every application** we receive (seriously!)

*Mobots come in all shapes, sizes, and backgrounds. We're focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you're excited about this role but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we still encourage you to apply.*

title: Assistant Manager
description:
Do you love Mexican food? Well, we do too! We founded Tacoria as a way of bringing the authentic tastes, vibrant colors, rich culture, and warm hospitality of Mexico to our local community. Our food is made fresh daily, and our ingredients come straight from local farms. (*For more on our story, visit our website: www.tacoria.com.*)

We are a fast growing company with 3 locations opening this year alone – great team members who wish to grow into salaried management positions will have the opportunity to do so very quickly. Due to our current growth and expansion, we currently have several **Assistant Manager** positions available at our restaurant.

Front of House Requirements:

* Friendly attitude, ability to work in a team environment
* Previous experience in a fast-paced environment in a customer-facing environment (preferred)
* Ability to handle money
* Previous experience working on a POS machine and a knowledge of technology (preferred)
* Ability to stand for multiple hours

Back of House Requirements:

* Age 18+
* Friendly attitude, ability to work in a team environment
* Previous experience in a fast-paced environment (preferred)
* Ability to stand for multiple hours
* Maintain cleanliness and comply with food sanitation requirements by properly handling food and ensuring correct storage
* Set up and stock food items and necessary supplies
* Prepare and cook food items with accuracy to specified standard

Benefits are available for full time employees, including paid sick time.

Previous experience working in a fast-paced environment is preferred, but we will train the right person. Shift leaders must have a demonstrated ability to lead a team. If you would like to be part of a fun, growing company with massive room for growth, reach out to us ASAP.

While **COVID-19 restrictions** have been lifted in NJ, we are dedicated to ensuring the safety and well-being of both our employees and our customers. We have sanitizing, disinfecting, and cleaning procedures in place and we require our employees to:

* Continue to wear personal protective equipment (provided)
* Allow for temperature screenings

*Visit us at our Company's website: tacoria.com*

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $16.25 - $16.50 per hour

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule

Work Location: In person

title: Private Practice Psychotherapist
description:
**Job Summary:** We are seeking a dedicated and entrepreneurial-minded Psychotherapist to join our team full-time. This role is perfect for a clinician looking to not only provide exceptional therapeutic care but also gain valuable insights into the operations of a private practice. The ideal candidate will manage a caseload of individual therapy clients, facilitate psychoeducation groups, and play a key role in our marketing and community engagement efforts. The mission of Wellness Tree Counseling Services is to promote wellness through a culturally sensitive lens so that individuals, families and communities are encouraged to rise to their full potential and engage life in meaningful ways. We value treating our clients and community with C.A.R.E. (Compassion, Affirming, Respect, & Empathy)

**Why Choose Us!** Wellness starts with us! At Wellness Tree Counseling, we prioritize and support the personal and professional development of our employees. We enhance employee wellness through a comprehensive wellness benefits package, flexible schedules, and a collaborative work environment. Join our team dedicated to nurturing your professional and personal development.

**Duties/Responsibilities:**

* Provide individual therapy sessions, managing a diverse caseload. Plan and facilitate psychoeducation groups that align with our mission and client needs.
* Contribute to the growth of our practice by participating in social media efforts, writing blogs, and creating content that reflects our brand’s mission and values.
* Lead and facilitate workshops, and actively engage in community events to increase brand visibility and promote our mission.
* Participating in staff meetings, training sessions, and supervisory processes.
* Perform additional responsibilities as assigned by the Clinical Director, including but not limited to assisting with the development and implementation of new programs and initiatives.

**Required Skills/Abilities:** 

* Knowledge of DSM-V, CBT, DBT, ACT, or other clinical modalities
* Ability to manage a client caseload of 15-25 clients
* Ability to work independently and/or use clinical judgment when needed.
* Knowledge of clinical documentation including treatment plan, progress note, bio-psychosocial assessment etc.
* Strong writing skills and a willingness to contribute to blogs and social media.
* A proactive, entrepreneurial spirit with an interest in private practice operations.
* Excellent communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills.

**Education and Experience:**

* Master’s degree in Social Work, Counseling, or a related field. Licensed in New York State as an LCSW, LMSW, LMHC, or equivalent or Limited Permit.
* Minimum of 1 year experience in individual therapy.
* Experience in group facilitation and psychoeducation.
* Experience and knowledge of mental health in BIPOC communities

**Physical Requirements:** 

* Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $30.00 - $35.00 per hour

Experience:

* Psychotherapy: 1 year (Required)

License/Certification:

* Licensed Clinical Social Worker (Required)
* LMHC (Required)
* LMSW (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 75% (Preferred)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Rego Park, NY 11374

title: Family Nurse Practitioner
description:
Essen Healthcare is currently seeking Board-Certified Nurse Practitioners for our Primary Care Division. We have openings in various locations: Bronx, Brooklyn, Queens, Manhattan, Long Island & Westchester County.

The Nurse Practitioner will be part of Essen growing medical professionals. Your primary responsibility will be to provide advanced primary and/or specialty care to our patients. Responsibilities will include but not limited to, performing physical exams, recording patient medical history, creating care plans and administering diagnostic test.

The selected candidate will be responsible to perform daily Nurse Practitioner duties including but not limited to:

* Examines, diagnoses and treats patients
* Ensures fulfillment of Essen Health Care commitment for ensuring quality care
* Diagnoses and treats variety of diseases in general practice
* Collects, records and maintains accurate patient information
* Documents items such as: past medical, family, and social history, review of systems, examinations, medications, allergies, assessment and plan
* Orders or executes various tests, analyses, and diagnostic images to provide information on patient's condition
* Analyzes reports and findings of tests and of examination, and diagnoses condition
* Administers or prescribes treatments
* Orders lab and imaging tests to determine and manage an immediate treatment plan
* Vaccinates patients to immunize patients from communicable diseases
* Advises patients concerning diet, hygiene, and methods for prevention of disease
* Consult with appropriate medical specialist when necessary; refer patient to subspecialists within network

The successful candidate will have the following Qualifications:

* Master's Degree in a Nurse Practitioner Program: FNP
* Current New York State License as a Nurse Practitioner.
* National Board Certification require
* American Association of Nurse Practitioners (AANP)
* American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC)
* Oncology Nursing Certification Corporation (ONCC)
* Bilingual (Spanish Speaking) is a plus
* EMR/EHR experience a plus
* New Grads are Encourage to Apply

Essen Health Care is a growing community healthcare network provides high quality, compassionate, and accessible medical care to some of the most vulnerable and under-served residents of New York State. Guided by a ‘population health’ model of care, Essen has five integrated clinical divisions offering services in primary & specialty offices, urgent care centers, and nursing homes, as well as house calls for home bound patients; all clinical services are also offered via telehealth. Our Care Management division supports patient-centered care through care coordination, complex care management and helping address health-related social needs.

Founded in 1999, Essen provides care in all five boroughs of New York City, with a primary focus in the Bronx. Staffed by over 300 primary and specialty care physicians and advanced clinicians, Essen Health Care is one of the largest, most comprehensive private medical groups in New York City. Essen maintains a Clinical Information Services team that maintains our enterprise-wide electronic medical record system, data repository, clinical analytics and population health capabilities. Our Community Services teams creates and sustains relationship with community organizations and agencies and health plans.

Essen is dedicated to ensuring the quality of care for all patients and has been designated ‘Level 3 Patient Centered Medical Home’ by the National Committee for Quality Assurance. Essen has won awards for its patient care innovations and recently launched Intention Health Ventures to develop and commercialize our technology innovations.

ESSEN HEALTH CARE IS PROUD TO BE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Essen Health care is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we seek candidates who desire to work in and serve an ethnically diverse population.

Job Type: Full-time

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract

Pay: $130,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Ability to Relocate:

* Bronx, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

### **Minimum qualifications:**

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* Experience building trusted-advisor relationships with executives, and managing multiple projects, business leads, and internal stakeholders.
* Experience with Google Ad Solutions, video advertising (e.g., AI-powered Performance and Video, CTV), with knowledge of competitor landscape across traditional and digital media advertising.
* Experience promoting YouTube or TV advertising solutions that align with and achieve client business objectives.
* Experience working with Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) advertisers.
* Knowledge of brand marketing and category-level marketing strategies.
* Ability to develop joint business plans in ambiguous environments, influence/collaborate across organizations, and drive business success for the customer and Google.

**About the job**
-----------------


Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.



Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.


The US base salary range for this full-time position is $152,000-$228,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.


Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Build and manage relationships with clients and senior partner stakeholders, develop an understanding of business challenges, marketing objectives, and success metrics.
* Structure a clear, long-term joint strategy between Google and clients, and lead a cross-functional team within Google to collaborate on projects and drive client success.
* Plan for and achieve growth goals through the presentation of Google advertising products/solutions that will help clients to meet their marketing objectives.
* Develop data-driven analyses and consultative recommendations that align with customer goals, and quantify high-impact opportunities with clear recommendations to present to customers.
* Build knowledge of how Google Advertising products work and can be used to help meet a wide range of marketing objectives.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: Cashier
description:
Do you love Mexican food? Well, we do too! We founded Tacoria as a way of bringing the authentic tastes, vibrant colors, rich culture, and warm hospitality of Mexico to our local community. Our food is made fresh daily, and our ingredients come straight from local farms. (*For more on our story, visit our website: www.tacoria.com.*)

We are a fast growing company with 3 locations opening this year alone – great team members who wish to grow into salaried management positions will have the opportunity to do so very quickly. Due to our current growth and expansion, we currently have several **Cashier** positions available at our restaurant.

Requirements:

* Friendly attitude, ability to work in a team environment
* Previous experience in a fast-paced environment in a customer-facing environment (preferred)
* Ability to handle money
* Previous experience working on a POS machine and a knowledge of technology (preferred)
* Ability to stand for multiple hours

*Cashier starting pay $12.00/hr PLUS $2-$4/hour in tips!* 

OVERTIME is available for full-time positions (Paid at time and a half)!

Benefits are available for full time employees, including paid sick time.

Previous experience working in a fast-paced environment is preferred, but we will train the right person. Shift leaders must have a demonstrated ability to lead a team. If you would like to be part of a fun, growing company with massive room for growth, reach out to us ASAP.

While **COVID-19 restrictions** have been lifted in NJ, we are dedicated to ensuring the safety and well-being of both our employees and our customers. We have sanitizing, disinfecting, and cleaning procedures in place and we require our employees to:

* Continue to wear personal protective equipment (provided)
* Allow for temperature screenings

*Visit us at our Company's website: tacoria.com*

Benefits:

* Employee discount

title: Outside Sales Representative
description:
**EquipmentShare is Hiring a Outside Sales Representative**



EquipmentShare is searching for a **Outside Sales Representative (Territory Account Manager)** for our Core Solutions rental location in **South Plainfield, NJ** to be responsible for expanding our existing customer base by building relationships with contractors and construction company principals. Core Solutions branches offer equipment rentals including aerial equipment, earth moving equipment, material handling equipment and more.


**Pay:** $24,000 - $200,000+ (Base + uncapped commissions with no market restrictions)


**Why We're a Better Place to Work**


* Competitive pay: Base salary plus uncapped commission
* Company provided truck or Vehicle allowance ($800/mo)
* Company provided cell phone or phone stipend
* Relocation assistance
* Medical, Dental and Vision benefits coverage for full-time employees
* 401(k) and company match
* Generous paid time off (PTO) plus company paid holidays
* Fitness Membership stipends plus seasonal and year round wellness challenges.
* Company sponsored events (annual family gatherings, food truck nights and more). Monthly family dinner nights
* Volunteering and local charity initiatives that help you nurture and grow the communities you call home. Employees receive 16 hours of paid volunteer time per year.
* Opportunities for career advancement and professional development


**Primary Responsibilities**


* Quickly respond to inbound leads and requests
* Expand our existing customer base by building relationships with contractors and construction company principals. Tell them about the numerous ways EquipmentShare can help save them money, make more money and operate more efficiently. In other words, educate them on how EquipmentShare solves their problems!
* Maintain and nurture existing customer relationships to ensure our customers are 100 percent satisfied with the level of service and support they receive from EquipmentShare. Keep them up-to-date about new or additional ways in which EquipmentShare can help improve their business.
* Promptly respond to and resolve customer inquiries, requests, complaints or other communications.
* Develop new sales strategies and techniques to increase our market share and improve our customer experience.


**About You**



Our mission to change an entire industry is not easily achieved, so we only hire people who are inspired by the goal and up for the challenge. In turn, our employees have every opportunity to grow with us, achieve personal and professional success and enjoy making a tangible difference in an industry that's long been resistant to change.


**Skills & Qualifications**


* First and foremost, we're looking for someone who's tenacious and innovative and possesses superior sales skills
* Industry knowledge (rental or construction) and experience in B2B is sales preferred, but not required (if you're a born salesperson, we'll train you on what you need to know and how to win more business)
* You have strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills
* You can adapt to the fast pace of a growing company and stay continuously educated on the latest EquipmentShare products and services
* You're competitive but thrive in a team-oriented environment


EquipmentShare is an EOE M/F/D/V
company_description: EquipmentShare is a construction technology solutions provider devoted to developing ways for the modern-day contractor to get more done.

title: Rogers International School: Art Teacher
description:
JobID: 11883  

**Position Type:**  

 Art  

**Date Posted:**  

 8/27/2024  

**Location:**  

 Stamford, CT  

**Date Available:**  

 2024-2025 School Year  


**The filling of this position is based upon continued funding in the Board of Education budget.**  

  

**Note: Teachers dually certified in TESOL, Bilingual Education or ESL, with experience in Sheltered Instruction or fluency in a language other than English, will be given preference for all Stamford Public School positions.**  

  

**Job Description -** Art Teacher  

  

**General Statement:**  

  

A competent **Art Teacher** understands growth and development, demonstrates knowledge of what is to be taught and facility in the basic skills and helps students to develop positive self-concepts. The **Art Teacher** stimulates the independence of each student as a learner, effectively assesses student needs and progress, and plans instruction to achieve selected objectives, including those appropriate for exceptional students. The **Art Teacher** accomplishes these objectives through effective communication with students, parents and colleagues and through the use of appropriate techniques and materials in a positive climate where time, space and equipment are effectively organized for instruction. In addition, the **Art Teacher** meets professional responsibility for continuing growth and fosters cooperative involvement with parents and the community.  

  

**Major Responsibilities:**
+ Demonstrates facility in the skills of the reading, writing and mathematics.
+ Demonstrates knowledge of the subject to be taught.
+ Demonstrates knowledge of human growth and development as it related to the teaching-learning process.
+ Demonstrates knowledge of the American public school system.
+ Plans instruction to achieve selected objectives.
+ Effectively implements instructional plan and use appropriate instructional techniques.
+ Effectively communicates with students.
+ Helps students develop positive self-concepts.
+ Facilitates the independence of the student as learner.
+ Effectively organizes time, space, materials and equipment for instruction.
+ Effectively assesses student needs and progress.
+ Effectively meets the needs of exceptional students.
+ Establishes a positive learning environment.
+ Meets professional responsibilities.
+ Encourages and maintains the cooperative involvement and support of parents and the community.

**Qualifications:**
+ A valid Connecticut teacher certificate in Art (#042).
+ Demonstrated excellence in teaching the subject area(s) and/or instructional levels targeted.
+ Evidence of ability to work cooperatively with administrators, teachers and educational assisants.
+ Evidence of organizational ability and willingness to pursue tasks to successful completion.
+ Superior communication skills (oral and written).
+ Knowledge of and/or demonstrate the ability to learn and implement Operating Systems (i.e. Windows); Office suites (i.e. Microsoft Office, Google Docs); Presentation Software (i.e. PowerPoint, Keynote); Spreadsheets (i.e. Excel, Google Spreadsheets); Communication and Collaboration tools (i.e. Skype); Accounting Software (i.e. QuickBooks); Student Information Systems (i.e. Naviance, Power School); or any other technology deemed relevant for this position.

  

**Union:**  

Stamford Education Association (SEA)  

  

**Salary:** $50,684 to $123,992  

Step Placement is based on education and experience as outlined in Article 4 (D) of the SEA Contract.  

  

**Application Procedures:**  

Online application is required.  

  

  

**External Applicants** - Please upload a minimum of 2 letters of reference, at least one of which is from a current or recent past supervisor.  

  

Letters of reference should be dated within the last two years.

title: Cloonan Middle School: Writing Teacher – Grade 8
description:
JobID: 11885  

**Position Type:**  

 Middle School Teaching/English/Language Arts  

**Date Posted:**  

 8/27/2024  

**Location:**  

 Stamford, CT  

**Date Available:**  

 2024-2025 School Year  


**The filling of this position is based upon continued funding in the Board of Education budget.**  

  

**Note: Teachers dually certified in TESOL, Bilingual Education or ESL, with experience in Sheltered Instruction or fluency in a language other than English, will be given preference for all Stamford Public School positions.**  

  

**General Statement:**  

The **Interdisciplinary Writing Teacher** instructs students to develop their writing skills across different subjects. They have a deep understanding of the growth and development of students and what needs to be taught to facilitate basic skills. They work to enhance students' ability to express their thoughts cohesively while emphasizing collaboration and peer feedback, empowering students to become proficient writers equipped to tackle diverse writing tasks. The teacher values effective written communication in various disciplines. They work to stimulate each student's independence as a learner, effectively assess their needs and progress, and plan instruction to achieve selected objectives, including those appropriate for exceptional students. To accomplish these objectives, the teacher uses proper techniques and materials in a positive learning environment where time, space, and equipment are effectively organized for instruction. They also effectively communicate with students, parents, and colleagues. In addition, they deliver an engaging curriculum aligned with the Common Core State Standards for writing, focusing on writing arguments to support claims with clear reasoning and relevant evidence, writing informative or explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information, and writing narratives using effective techniques, appropriate details, and well-structured event sequences. The Interdisciplinary Writing Teacher reports to the building administration and collaborates with the grade-level team to implement interdisciplinary writing units.  

  

**Major Responsibilities:**
+ Instruct students to develop their writing skills across various subjects, understanding the developmental stages of writing, and tailoring instruction to meet students' needs.
+ Assist students in expressing their thoughts cohesively in writing, emphasizing collaboration and peer feedback to empower them as proficient writers capable of addressing diverse writing tasks.
+ Instill an appreciation for effective written communication in different disciplines, recognizing its importance across academic and professional contexts.
+ Foster each student's independence as a learner, assessing their individual needs and progress and planning instruction to achieve specific objectives, including those tailored for exceptional students.
+ Implement appropriate instructional techniques and materials within a positive learning environment, ensuring that time, space, and equipment are effectively organized for instruction.
+ Maintain effective communication with students, parents, and colleagues, fostering a supportive learning community and addressing any concerns or issues promptly.
+ Deliver an engaging curriculum aligned with the Common Core State standards for writing, focusing on writing arguments, informative or explanatory texts, and narratives while integrating interdisciplinary content and approaches.
+ Facilitate inquiry-based learning by guiding students through short research projects, helping them draw on multiple sources to answer questions and adjust their focus as needed.
+ Report to building administration on student progress and collaborate with grade-level teams to implement interdisciplinary writing units, promoting coherence and consistency across the curriculum.

  

**Physical and Mental Demands, Work Hazards:**  

Works in standard office and school building environments.  

  

**Knowledge and Skills:**
+ Commitment to creating schools that provide an education that cultivates productive habits of mind, body, and heart in every student.
+ Demonstrated knowledge of Common Core State Standards for writing and pedagogical practices.
+ Demonstrated knowledge of human growth and development as it relates to the teaching and learning process.
+ Evidence of ability to work cooperatively with administrators, teachers and educational assistants.
+ Evidence of organizational ability and willingness to pursue tasks to successful completion.
+ Superior communication skills (oral and written).
+ Knowledge of and/or demonstrate the ability to learn and implement Operating Systems (i.e. Windows); Office suites (i.e. Microsoft Office, Google Docs); Presentation Software (i.e. PowerPoint, Keynote); Spreadsheets (i.e. Excel, Google Spreadsheets); Communication and Collaboration tools (i.e. Skype); Accounting Software (i.e. QuickBooks); Student Information Systems (i.e. Naviance, PowerSchool); or any other technology deemed relevant for this position.


  

**Qualifications:**
+ CT CSDE Teaching Certification endorsed for Humanities:
	- Elementary, K-6 (013) or Elementary, 1–6 (305) (for 6th Grade only)
	- English, 7–12 (015)
	- English, Middle School, 4–8 (215)
	- History & Social Studies, 7–12 (026)
	- History & Social Studies, Middle School, 4–8 (226)
+ Such alternatives to the above qualifications as the Superintendent and/or Stamford Board of Education may find appropriate.

Stamford Education Association (SEA)

186 days

title: Assistant Research Scientist/Scholar Non-exempt (Birnbaum Lab)
description:
New York University: NYU - NY: Arts and Science (A&S): Biology and Genomics
### **Location**

New York, NY
### **Open Date**

Aug 27, 2024
### **Deadline**

Aug 31, 2024 at 11:59 PM Eastern Time
### **Description**

The Birnbaum Lab at NYU’s Department of Biology is looking for a highly motivated and independent individual to work as an Assistant Research Scientist/Scholar Part Time Non-exempt at 27 hours/week.



Projects in the Birnbaum lab include regeneration in plants using single-cell RNA-seq and other techniques. The lab focuses on root development with ongoing projects on a systemic analysis of mobile transcription factors in cell-cell communication, patterning in regeneration, metabolic responses to injury, and comparative cellular genomics among grasses.



Responsibilities include working with postdocs and graduate students in the projects described above by cloning reporters, analyzing mutants at the genetic and phenotyping levels, propagating plants, developing cell sorting assisted screens, performing live confocal microscopy, and preparing histological samples.



In compliance with NYC’s Pay Transparency Act, the annual base salary range for this position is $42,000 to $47,000. New York University considers factors such as (but not limited to) the specific grant funding and the terms of the research grant when extending an offer.



### **Qualifications**

The ideal candidate will have an undergraduate degree in biology or related field and six months or more of laboratory experience.



### **Application Instructions**

Please upload your application materials via Interfolio. Include the following items: 1) CV; 2) a list of two references and their contact information.
company_description: NYU has emerged as a worldwide institution for learning, teaching, researching, building knowledge, and inventing new ways to meet humanity’s challenges.

title: Dispatcher
description:
The Brink’s name is a promise to respect the trust we’ve earned in over 150 years in business. Every employee honors that promise by offering the highest levels of service and support to our customers. We take pride in our work, and we share a passion about our future. Learn why so many people have made the choice to join our team – and stay here.
Job Title
Dispatcher
Job Description
Brink’s Global Services is a division of Brink’s Inc, the world’s premier provider of secure logistics and security solutions in more than 122 countries across 5 continents. Brink’s Global Services specializes in the secure transportation and handling of valuable goods throughout the logistic value chain, from raw materials and components to finished products within the mining, banknote, precious metal, jewelry, security, art and pharmaceutical industries The company has a proud history of providing growth and advancement opportunities for its employees. We have a challenging opportunity for a Command Center Operator based out of our Springfield Gardens, NY location.
Hourly Rate: $27.55
Job Summary:
The Command Center Operator is responsible for preparing employee routing in conjunction with schedules and customer needs as well as dispatching, monitoring and recording necessary data on a daily/weekly and monthly basis in accordance with customer requirements. This position will work very closely with our 580 Ops group, customers and all internal support departments including Sales, Customer Service and Finance to ensure that all customer needs are met to BGS’ high standards of achievement. This position functions in an armed environment. This position requires the enforcement of rules to protect the premises and property of Brink's and its customers and in armored vehicles in transit, as well as the safety of persons on the premises of Brink's and its customers.
Key Responsibilities:* Monitor, transmit and receive information over radio and telephone to detect emergencies, exchange information or provide dispatch services.
* Coordinate and dispatch special routes and additional assignments of new accounts to established runs.
* Identify problems or potential problem areas and recommend solutions.
* Direct, regulate and prioritize the movement of traffic in parking lot, loading ramps and receiving docks. Allocate parking as required for service and delivery vehicles; maintain access to driveways and dock areas and facilitate the timely removal of vehicles as appropriate.
* Plans delivery by organizing truck loads and routing schedules.
* Coordinates delivery and pickup with the customer and sales department.
* Oversees the loading of shipments onto trailers or trucks.
* Oversees the preparation of delivery documents for truckers.
* Communicate effectively and clearly and possess strong business acumen skills related to the logistics of transporting valuable shipments.
* Maintain appropriate records, including but not limited to guide sheets, employee attendance, and accident reports in partnership with the Operations and Executive Operations Management team.
* Manage all paperwork, internal administrative processes and all related processes/policies endemic to the shipping/logistics process in accordance with Brinks policy and all general security guidelines.
* Work closely with all vault operations as necessary and manage the fulfillment of customer special requests as necessary and communicate the same to all needed partners.


Minimum Qualifications:* Minimum of 1 year of experience in dispatch, routing, transportation/logistics and/or be able to demonstrate success in previously held positions such as but not limited to armed Messenger/Air Courier Messenger in a similar environment.
* Minimum of 3 years working with Microsoft Office and logistics software
* Be at least 21 years of age

title: Interoceanic Careers
description:
**Join Our Dynamic Team Across Multiple Departments!**

  

Interoceanic Corporation (IOC) is a family of businesses that covers several different sectors including fertilizers, industrial chemicals, logistical assets, lawn and garden business, ice melt as well as private investments. We have cultivated a solid network and have operational capacity spanning decades of domestic and international exposure. As the business has grown, so have the potential acquisition opportunities that come across our desk. Rooted in industry traditions, our business is grounded in excellent service. The IOC family of companies is always growing. At the same time, our unique entrepreneurial spirit propels the scope of our capabilities while offering our highly valued employees the opportunity to grow, develop and showcase their individual talents. We are looking for talented individuals to join us in various departments:

 **Operations Team:** Our operations team is diverse and integral, covering everything from barge and vessel logistics, rail transport, and trucking to meticulous inventory management. We also have a burgeoning retail team, responsible for managing multiple accounts and ensuring our partner stores are always well-stocked and achieving strong sales.

 **Compliance and Credit Team:** Our Compliance and Credit team ensures that we adhere to all processes, protocols, laws, and regulations across departments. They are the gatekeepers of our integrity, making sure we operate within legal boundaries while maintaining the highest standards.

 **Sales Team:** Our sales team goes beyond mere transactions. We build long-lasting relationships with our clients and partners, leveraging our deep understanding of operations to offer tailored solutions that meet their needs.

 **Accounting and Finance Team:** This team is the financial engine of our company, managing all aspects of our finances, except payroll. They ensure the financial health and stability of our growing company, providing critical insights and managing our financial operations with precision.

 **Data Analytics Team:** Innovation is at the heart of what we do, and our data analytics team is leading the charge. They implement advanced ERP systems, streamline processes, and introduce innovative approaches that leverage technology and data to drive efficiency and growth.

 **HR Team:** Our HR team is dedicated to supporting our employees and enhancing the company culture. They manage payroll, benefits, performance, recruitment, onboarding, training, development initiatives, and employee relations. They also devise strategies to continuously improve the work environment and ensure that our team members thrive.

 **Benefits:**

  

* Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
* Health, dental, and vision insurance.
* Retirement savings plan with company match.
* Career development and training opportunities.
* Friendly and collaborative work environment.

  



Interoceanic Corporation (IOC) is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status

title: Home Care Staffing Coordinator - (Bilingual: Spanish))
description:
**Company Overview:** Empowering Health, Enriching Lives: True Care’s Enduring Mission

  

At True Care, we stand as a beacon of compassion and excellence in home healthcare. With a profound commitment to enhancing the quality of life for individuals and families, our mission is to provide holistic, personalized care that empowers health and enriches lives.

  

Every day, we embark on a journey to bring comfort, vitality, and dignity to those we serve. Our mission is driven by a deep understanding of the unique needs and aspirations of each individual under our care. We believe that home is not just a place but a sanctuary where healing and well-being flourish best. Hence, we endeavor to make this sanctuary a haven of health and happiness.

  

We pledge to create a nurturing environment where our clients and their families feel heard, valued, and supported. Our highly trained and empathetic professionals are not just caregivers but partners in the pursuit of well-rounded wellness. With a focus on open communication, collaboration, and respect, we forge lasting relationships that transcend the boundaries of traditional healthcare

  

Our mission is to be a guiding light, illuminating the path toward optimal health and well-being. As we navigate challenges and triumphs together, we remain resolute in our dedication to uplifting lives, one compassionate interaction at a time.

  

At True Care, we don't just offer home healthcare – we offer hope, healing, and a brighter tomorrow.

 **Position title**: Home Care Staffing Coordinator

 **Job summary:** The CDPAP Scheduling Coordinator is responsible for coordinating caregiver placement and visit confirmations between the Home Health Aides and our patients. Responsibilities include creating and maintaining staff schedules, confirming attendance and communicating with the caregivers, patients and their families while adhering to True Care’s policies and procedures. He/she performs case management for the assigned caseload and works to provide best quality service.

 **Responsibilities include:**


* Strategically coordinate placement of services between clients in their homes and the caregivers on HHA eXchange
* Successfully maintain a caseload of 80-90 patients ensuring they receive the best homecare service
* Participate in departmental trainings
* Assist the Team Lead with coverage and work with the team members with any staffing challenges
* Communicate openly with other staff in the department regarding scheduling, availability, attendance, and larger scale issues; ensuring documentation is being updated for all of our caregivers and patients in HHA eXchange
* Verify caregivers’ attendance for daily ensuring they are attending their scheduled cases and be able to prioritize staffing cases for no-shows, call-outs or any missed visits based on the patient’s needs of care
* Handle and respond promptly to incoming calls, emails or faxes from physicians, contracts or clients requesting report status and/or information; communicate with contracts for patient status
* Communicate with patients and their families regarding appointment scheduling, physician plan of care, appointment changes, no shows and/or cancellations
* Maintain and document communication with all caregivers in HHA eXchange; coordinate the caregivers’ schedules and maintain a schedule of all services per month
* Verify billed services against requested services
* Maintain patient confidentiality and privacy with dignity and respect
* Participate in patient case conferences, in-service programs, exit interviews for caregivers and orientation
* Manage phone calls in a supportive, reassuring manner for patients, families, physicians, and others

  


**Job requirements:**


* High School diploma/ GED equivalent
* **Must be bilingual in Spanish**
* Knowledge of HHA eXchange is highly preferred
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills
* Able to deal with difficult or sensitive situations in person or on the phone
* Excellent customer service having empathy and patience in working for elderly population
* Able to multitask and work in an extremely fast paced environment
* Ability to maintain a professional demeanor when handling issues

  



True Care provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, disability, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law.

title: Community Outreach Associate
description:
Community Outreach Associate

  

Company Overview:

  

Empowering Health, Enriching Lives: True Care’s Enduring Mission

  

At True Care¹, we stand as a beacon of compassion and excellence in home healthcare. With a profound commitment to enhancing the quality of life for individuals and families, our mission is to provide holistic, personalized care that empowers health and enriches lives.

  

Every day, we embark on a journey to bring comfort, vitality, and dignity to those we serve. Our mission is driven by a deep understanding of the unique needs and aspirations of each individual under our care. We believe that home is not just a place but a sanctuary where healing and well-being flourish best. Hence, we endeavor to make this sanctuary a haven of health and happiness.

  

We pledge to create a nurturing environment where our clients and their families feel heard, valued, and supported. Our highly trained and empathetic professionals are not just caregivers but partners in the pursuit of well-rounded wellness. With a focus on open communication, collaboration, and respect, we forge lasting relationships that transcend the boundaries of traditional healthcare.
