title: Publishing Assistant, Penguin Young Readers (Hybrid)
description:
Penguin Young Readers is looking for a Publishing Assistant to join the Publishing Office. This role offers a great opportunity to learn about the publishing industry and overall marketplace. While this position reports to the two Assistant Directors of Publishing in the publishing office, it offers the chance to work closely with the entire division, including our marketing, publicity, and sales teams as well as the editorial imprints.

  



The Publishing Assistant will be involved in a wide variety of activities that support Penguin Young Reader’s brands and business development efforts, including sales and marketplace analysis, metadata, product licensing, and administrative tasks. This role is a great opportunity for a driven problem solver and organized multitasker who enjoys tackling interesting and challenging tasks while supporting books for all ages, including series like Mad Libs and authors such as Eric Carle, Roald Dahl, Jacqueline Woodson, and John Green, to name a few. The Assistant should be highly motivated, enthusiastic about publishing, and have an interest in children’s books.

 **Please apply using our ATS system by August 28, 2024 and include your resume for consideration. Before applying for any role at Penguin Random House, we recommend you review our** **applicant resources page****and look over our open-to-remote guidelines on our** **FAQs page.**

 **Responsibilities:**

* Run regular sales and competitive reports and share that information with various departments across the division, including sales, marketing, and editorial teams
* Administrative support of publishing office and brand department which includes setting up and running (virtual) meetings, locating materials/jackets/etc., and overseeing divisional hospitality for new hires and authors/agents
* Prepare PowerPoint presentations and/or Excel grids for meetings including business reviews, conferences, and divisional meetings
* Provides routine support in a variety of areas, including licensing, brand management, title metadata and description
* Supports various divisional special projects and research requests, such as an editorial directory update or industry trend deep-dive
* Process physical product samples from licensing partners
* Assist with internal events such as author visits, guest speakers, and social events

 **Requirements:**

* Proficiency with Microsoft Office, particularly Excel and PowerPoint
* Ability to multitask and prioritize multiple projects
* Strong organizational skills
* An interest in the business side of publishing and analysis
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Flexibility and interest in new challenges and adaptable to changing needs

 **Preferred Qualifications:**


* An interest in children’s books
* Knowledge of and interest in industry trends and topics
* Aptitude for numbers

 **The salary for this position is $48,000. All positions are currently eligible for annual profit award or bonus, subject to Company results.**

title: Hospital Service Desk Manager
description:
**Hospital Service Desk Manager**  

SPHS-Info Tech-Infrastructure
  

  

The Hospital Service Desk Manager will:  

* Manage IT Helpdesk and Desktop Support Services
* Develop and maintain formal support procedures for consistency and increased productivity.
* Analyze Helpdesk and Desktop support performance through statistical reports and provide constructive feedback and performance modifications as required.
* Schedule and staff multiple helpdesk shifts across a 24 x 7 period including coverage for vacations, holidays, and sick times for every day of the year.
* Ensure staff is recognized for excellent customer service and job performance as demonstrated by end user satisfaction surveys.
* Train staff on mission-critical applications and technologies as they are implemented within the organization.
* Provide support templates, training, and software/hardware tools necessary to decrease problem resolution time, increase helpdesk front end problem resolution, and reduce desktop support tickets.
* Work with helpdesk support vendor to assure certified helpdesk analysts assigned to Saint Peter's are well trained and capable of assisting a diverse customer-base.
* Perform annual staff performance reviews of employees and in conjunction with associated helpdesk support vendors (helpdesk analysts only) to ensure goals and performance measures are met.
* Address other human resources issues with Human Resources Department and with vendor (helpdesk analysts only) as they arise (poor performance, excellent performance, staff changes, etc.).
* Work with desktop supervisor to monitor helpdesk and desktop customer satisfaction surveys and provide service recovery when subpar performance is identified.
* Establish strong communication channels between helpdesk personnel and desktop support to ensure synergies between two areas are fully maximized, and customer experience is seamless.
* Schedule meetings with staff to discuss hospital, departmental and service based topics on a regular basis.
* Develop desktop supervisor position as back-up. Plans goals and objectives for the overall service desk team
* Thoroughly identify and document objectives and priorities based upon identified user needs, current IT projects, budgetary considerations and mission.
* Develop plans to meet objectives and priorities in accordance with established procedures.
* Review/update goals and plans to reflect changes in policy, needs and communicates changes to staff in a timely manner.
* Assist the CTO in planning/managing the annual budget for service desk operations Establishes budget forecast and ensures adherence to budget goals through cost control.
* Approve or disapprove inventory supply orders.
* Designate desktop supervisor to monitor and maintain inventory of supplies and spare PC/Printer equipment.
* Promptly inform the CTO of any critical shortages impacting the service desk operations
* Evaluate the budgetary impact on IT Infrastructure services by keeping track of all actual expenditures and monitoring against associated G/L line item budgets.
* Project Management Works with other healthcare system, hospital and IT Management to execute projects, particularly where the project requires desktop and helpdesk services.
* Ensure necessary training is provided to desktop and helpdesk personnel as it relates to project and IT involvement.
* Coordinate activities between the helpdesk and desktop supervisor to ensure that project time lines and objectives are set and adhered to.
* Complete projects and tasks as assigned

  

**Requirements:**  

* Knowledge and experience in project management, staff scheduling, helpdesk analytics, systems monitoring, application support, incident management, and vendor management, as usually acquired upon completion of Bachelors degree or 10+ years in IT customer service field providing helpdesk and desktop services, including 4+ years serving in a supervisory role.

  

Schedule: Hybrid  

  

Grade 130

title: Assistant Production Editorial Director, Crown and Crown Currency (Hybrid)
description:
Crown Publishing Group is seeking an Assistant Director to join its Production Editorial department, reporting to the Executive Managing Editor. You will be a key member of a management team and will support the dynamic Crown and Crown Currency imprints, publishers of bestselling fiction and nonfiction and such authors as Barack Obama, Erik Larson, Mustafa Suleyman, Sally Rooney, Liane Moriarty, and many others. The ideal candidate will be ready to take on and progress in a management role, love bookmaking, and have an ear for language.

 **Please apply by August 31, 2024 and include your resume, cover letter, and salary requirements for consideration. Before applying for any role at Penguin Random House, we recommend you review our** **applicant resources page** **and look over our open-to-remote guidelines on our** **FAQs page.**

 **Responsibilities include:**

* Work with the Managing Editor, Publishers, and editorial team to create and maintain schedules, anticipate and solve problems, and improve workflows.
* Work with other Production Editorial Directors to lead, manage, and support the PE team: assign titles; provide oversight and backup; advise on bookmaking standards and matters of style; analyze and implement workflows within the PE team and with other departments.
* Supervise at least two PEs.
* Production edit 15 to 20 original titles per year.

 **Required Skills / Knowledge / Experience:**

* A minimum of 7 to 10 years’ experience as a production editor at a trade publishing house.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
* Flexibility and creativity, and the desire to face challenges and to adapt and improve processes, with respect for all stakeholders.
* Excellent copyediting and proofreading skills and a working knowledge of *The Chicago Manual of Style*. 17th edition, and *Webster’s*, 11th edition.
* Detail- and accuracy-oriented; organized; able to set priorities and remain levelheaded under pressure.
* Ability to production edit complicated projects in a deadline-driven environment, maintaining high standards and juggling multiple projects.
* Manage a large roster of freelance copy editors, proofreaders, and indexers; supervise and evaluate their work; recruit and develop new freelancers.
* Strong computer skills, including mastery of Microsoft Word, electronic text coding, and Adobe Acrobat.

 **The salary range for this position is $80,000-$95,000. All positions are currently eligible for annual profit award or bonus, subject to Company results.**

title: Associate Manager, Production - (Hybrid)
description:
Random House Children’s Books is seeking a collaborative and detail-oriented Associate Manager to join our Brands and Licenses book team. In this role, you’ll be managing the complete book production process from release of layout files to warehouse delivery and archiving final files. If you enjoy working on a variety of children’s book formats including picture books, novelty books, and chapter books in a creative and team-oriented environment, this is an opportunity you don’t want to miss!

  

The Random House Children’s Book production department is filled with talented individuals who are passionate about making high-quality children’s books. We work closely with editors and designers to carefully bring each project to fruition. This role reports to the Production Director for Brands and Licenses, whose team handles titles for several imprints within Random House Children’s Books, including Golden Books, Random House BFYR, Random House/Disney, Bright Matter Books, and The Princeton Review, and iconic brands such as Dr. Seuss, Little Golden Books, and Richard Scarry.

 **Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**

  

* Consulting with Publishing group to develop the specifications for individual titles
* Cost estimating, including multiple options for a variety of book formats
* Entering and maintaining book specifications in SAP
* Creating book schedules and maintaining dates in Filemaker Pro
* Daily communication with both domestic and overseas suppliers
* Preflighting of interior and component files in InDesign and Acrobat
* Sending files to outside prepress houses/printers and trafficking and color review of all proof passes
* Issuing prepress and manufacturing purchase orders and approving invoices
* Archiving of final print files in-house as well as managing and sending archive files to licensors

 **Requirements:**

  

* Minimum of 5 years of relevant book production experience.
* Proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time and to effectively problem solve.
* Knowledge of prepress, color correction printing, binding, and special effects.
* Excellent verbal and written communication and organizational skills
* Proficient basic math skills to accurately complete book cost estimates
* Experience with Adobe Creative Suite and Microsoft Office
* Familiarity with SAP and Filemaker Pro a plus

 **The salary for this position is $63,000.****This is a hybrid position with in-office responsibilities, we will consider candidates who can work from a commutable distance to our offices at 1745 Broadway, which includes the tri-state area (NJ, CT, & PA).**

title: Marketing Assistant, Random House Children's Books (Hybrid)
description:
**Marketing Assistant, Random House Children's Books (Hybrid)**


The Random House Children’s Book’s Marketing Department seeks a Marketing Assistant to join our team. Reporting to the Senior Director of Trade Marketing and Strategic Development and the Executive Director, School & Library Marketing, the role offers the opportunity to work closely with an innovative group of marketers collaborating in a fast-paced environment and to support marketing initiatives for our titles and authors while helping champion our Random House Children’s Books frontlist and backlist to readers everywhere.

  

Random House Children’s Books is home to bestselling and award-winning trade authors and illustrators from Max and Suzanne Lang (*Grumpy Monkey*) and Emily Winfield Martin (*The Wonderful Things You Will Be**)* to Nic Stone (author of *Dear Martin**)* and Karen McManus (*One of Us Is Lying*), Nicola Yoon (*Everything, Everything* and *The Sun Is Also a Star*), Holly Jackson (*A Good Girl’s Guide to Murder*) Christopher Paolini (The Inheritance Cycle) and renowned brands like Dr. Seuss and Richard Scarry.

  

The Marketing Assistant should be highly motivated, enthusiastic about publishing, and have an interest in children’s books. This role will work with colleagues in other departments within the division, especially our Publishing Office, Sales, Publicity, Book Design and Editorial groups. The Assistant will be a detail-oriented self-starter, a strong written and verbal communicator, and an organized multitasker who is comfortable asking for help when needed and wants to be an active participant on a collaborative team. If you can manage the details of urgent tasks immediately but also remember to step back, consider the big picture, and adjust your strategy when needed, you'll assume greater marketing responsibilities over time.

 ***This hybrid position has occasional in-office responsibilities, including but not limited to in-office meetings, mailings, library and promotional collection management, and other daily ad hoc administrative projects. We will consider candidates who can work from a commutable distance to our offices at 1745 Broadway, which includes the tri-state area (NJ, CT, & PA)***

 ***Please apply using our ATS system by August 29, 2024, and include your resume and cover letter for consideration. Before applying for any role at Penguin Random House we recommend you review our*** **applicant resources page** ***and*** **FAQs page.**

 **The Role:**

* Working closely with the Senior Director of Trade Marketing and Strategic Development as well as members of the Sales and Publishing teams to plan and optimize a schedule of seasonal key dates, with input from members across the Marketing teams
* Developing and maintaining the divisional seasonal title grid and all supporting documents
* Providing major support for our key seasonal meetings including scheduling, maintaining and communicating key moments and milestones, creating meeting invites and agendas, setting up and maintaining campaign plan documents, scheduling follow-up meetings and taking and disseminating notes
* Maintaining regular communication from Marketing to other divisional departments
* Working closely with the Senior Director of Trade Marketing and Strategic Development and the wider Marketing team to plan for and produce seasonal print and digital Sales materials, in partnership with Managing Editorial and Book Production
* Support the School & Library Marketing department in administrative needs including mailings, website updating, overall file and material storage and organization, invoicing, POS setup, and more
* Providing general administrative support to the Senior Director of Trade Marketing and Strategic Development, the Executive Director of School & Library Marketing, and the Senior Vice President of Marketing and the including managing meeting calendars, creating and sharing key documents, and providing support across the Marketing organization

**The Essentials:**

* An ability to communicate effectively, efficiently, and meet deadlines
* Strong sense of urgency with an ability to juggle multiple projects in a fast-paced environment and ability to think on their feet and address unexpected challenges
* Excellent writing and communication skills as well as being detail-oriented and organized
* Self-motivated with a desire to be a team player as well as work independently
* An ability to anticipate manager’s needs and the needs of the department
* A creative mindset with an enjoyment for being challenged and taking risks

***The salary for this position is $48,000. All positions are currently eligible for annual profit award or bonus, subject to Company results.***

title: Administrative Assistant - (Onsite)
description:
We are seeking an experienced Administrative Assistant to join our team and provide day-to-day support to the Executive Office at Penguin Random House. The role reports to the Manager of the Executive Office & Global Projects and will work very closely with the Executive Office including the CEO, CFO and Chief Strategy Officer. This position offers excellent insight into the overall world of publishing and is ideal for someone who is extremely organized, process-oriented and excels in communicating and working in a fast-paced environment. The role includes extensive interaction with a variety of global and US colleagues across all departments.

 **This is a fully in-office position based in midtown NYC.**

 **Responsibilities:**

  

* Provide general administrative support for the day-to-day operations of the CEO office
* Support with calendar management and scheduling for multiple executives
* Travel: arrange domestic and international travel, create detailed travel itineraries
* Expenses: collect expense receipts, prepare, submit, and monitor expense reports via Concur in a timely manner for multiple executives
* Manage office materials (monitoring existing supplies, ordering, and receiving)
* Manage book displays: coordinate title selection and book ordering for book displays in a variety of locations
* Draft communications for distribution
* Support in planning and coordinating high volume of meetings and special events (greeting visitors, room setup, catering orders, IT coordination)
* Support with special projects as needed

 **Qualification & Skills:**

  



* A minimum of three years of closely-related experience with at least 5 years preferred
* Strong computer skills: proficiency with Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint are required
* Excellent time management skills, and able to prioritize and multi-task
* Quick learner, and able to take and understand direction easily
* Exceptional verbal communication & excellent writing skills are both essential
* Professional, friendly, and helpful manner in person, on the phone, and in all correspondence is a must.
* Able to work well under pressure and handle multiple responsibilities in a deadline-driven and dynamic environment
* Strong sense of integrity with the ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion
* Demonstrates a creative and resourceful approach to problem-solving

  



**The salary range for this position is $60,000-$80,000. All positions are currently eligible for annual profit award or bonus, subject to Company results. Please apply using our online application process and include a cover letter with your résumé.**

title: Manager, Account Marketing - (Open to remote)
description:
Our team collaborates with a number of departments within the publishing divisions. Works closely with publicity and sales to set up author tours at bookstores, libraries, and book festivals. Identifies new opportunities for authors. Collaborates with customer service and sales reps to ensure that events run smoothly. Works with VP, Account Marketing on a variety of marketing initiatives.

 **Responsibilities:**

  

* Acts as a liaison between sales department and various publicity departments.
* Works with sales reps and bookstores, festivals and libraries to solicit author tours.
* Develops, maintains, and strengthens relationships with accounts and collaborates with publicity and sales reps.
* Arranges visits between bookseller partners, publicity, and members of the sales team.
* Manages additional account marketing projects as needed, including ongoing marketing initiatives at independent bookstores and various consumer-facing shows.
* Manages first-edition club process.
* Proactively troubleshoots author tour issues.
* Attends sales conferences, trade conferences, and marketing meetings.
* Manages various key projects for the department related to marketing and ongoing programs
* Collaborates with field reps and sales management on retail sales initiatives

 **Requirements:**

* Minimum 4 years of trade publishing or bookstore experience, preferably in sales, publicity, or events
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to multitask and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
* Excellent organizational and follow-up skills
* Strong attention to detail
* Ability to effectively problem solve
* Proficient with Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Outlook
* Proficiency with Excel including intermediate skills and the ability to create and manage workflow using advanced functions and formulas (e.g. VLOOKUP and similar)
* Familiarity with Edelweiss
* Knowledge of multiple bookselling channels

 **The salary range for this role is $70,000 - $73,000. All positions are currently eligible for annual profit award or bonus, subject to company results.**

title: Registered Nurse Med Surg Float Pool
description:
**Registered Nurse Med Surg Float Pool**  

Med-Surg Float Pool
  

  

Saint Peter's is the 5th hospital worldwide to earn Magnet status SIX times in a row. Our team of award-winning nurses is growing, and we are looking for talented, compassionate RNs to join our team.
  

  

The Registered Nurse Med Surg Float Pool will:  

* Be a positive contributor to our collaborative nursing team
* Utilize excellent assessment skills to determine the health status of assigned patients as outlined in the Nursing Standards
* Ensure all procedures are performed based on established Standards of Care
* Administer medications and parenteral therapies in accordance with policy
* Meticulously document all aspects of patient care

  

**Requirements:**  

* Licensed as a Registered Nurse in the State of New Jersey
* BSN preferred or must be obtained within three (3) years of hire date
* BLS certification required, as approved by the American Heart Association
* ECG certification obtained during clinical orientation

  

Grade 126

title: Associate Business Analyst - (Open to remote)
description:
Penguin Random House (PRH), the world’s largest trade book publisher, is seeking an Associate Business Analyst to join the 9-member Publishing Operations team, which supports the core processes used by PRH employees across all departments, including Managing Editorial, Production, Inventory, Marketing, Publicity, Design, Sales, IT, Customer Service, and Fulfillment.

  

Penguin Random House is home to genre-defining children’s literature, from *Dragons Love Tacos* to *The Phantom Tollbooth*; best-in-class storytellers including Margaret Atwood, Tommy Orange, Celeste Ng, and Jasmine Guillory; and culture-shaping works such as *Becoming* by Michelle Obama and *Daisy Jones & the Six* by Taylor Jenkins Reid.

  

This role will include requirements gathering, data analysis and user support. Our team supports the PRH SAP MM, PP, and PS modules. This is a great opportunity for someone with SAP consulting experience who enjoys complex problem solving. This is a business analyst position and does not require SAP coding.

 **Responsibilities:**

  

* Document business requirements, analyze problems, propose solutions, and recommend prioritization.
* Translate technical problems and solutions into business language to facilitate decision making.
* Collaborate with developers to translate functional specs into technical specifications.
* Create test cases and execute to test system enhancements.
* Troubleshoot system issues with the user community and IT; these issues include tracking down data problems on individual titles, mass data updates, and system configuration; triage and escalate appropriately.
* Use database tools to pull large data sets and use the analysis of that data to identify issues and solutions for individual divisions or the company.
* Manage data extraction, create reporting and data maintenance in SAP as needed.
* Promote knowledge transfer within and beyond the team by documenting issues and processes and communicating best practices to users.
* Work collaboratively on projects toward common goals.

 **Requirements:**

  

* 3 – 5 years of ERP analyst experience required.
* SAP experience in MM/PP/PS modules is preferable.
* Analytical, data-driven approach; logical thinker with ability to articulate meaningful conclusions found in the data.
* Strong communication and customer service skills with ability to assess “wants” vs. “needs” and translate what is at the heart of user requirements.
* Proven ability to translate business challenges into system solutions.
* Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Advanced Excel / Access Macros/SQL query experience a plus.
* Ability to understand ABAP code is a plus.
* Experience in book publishing is a big plus.

 **The salary range for this position is $65,000 – 70,000. All positions are currently eligible for annual profit award or bonus, subject to company results.**

title: Slitter Operator
description:
Description:

Allstate Can, a division of The Ohio Art Company, is in need of a Shipping & Receiving Clerk. This position will require work on-site 4 days a week with overtime potential on weekends. (Mon-Thurs 6am-4:30pm)


Key Responsibilities:

* Prepare slitting machines for operation by adjusting settings, loading installing cutting blades and ensuring all components are in place.
* Operate machinery in accordance with company procedures and safety guidelines.
* Monitor the slitting process to ensure the accurate cutting of materials according to specifications.
* Ensure products are made to quality standards.
* Perform routine maintenance procedures on slitting equipment to prevent breakdowns and uphold peak performance standards.
* Identify and resolve equipment malfunctions through systematic troubleshooting and timely repairs.
* Adhere to safety protocols and procedures to create a safe work environment for yourself and others.

**In addition to competitive compensation and growth potential, the benefit package includes:**

* Medical insurance
* Paid vacation
* 11 paid holidays
* I.A.M National Pension Fund


Successful candidates must display a willingness to work overtime hours as needed and possess the ability to lift up to 50 pounds occasionally. Requirements:

Requirements:

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Proven experience as a machine operator with at least 2-3 years experience or similar role.
* Strong mechanical aptitude and the ability to troubleshoot machinery issues effectively
* Ability to read and interpret technical manuals and schematics
* Experience with hand and power tools
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Ability to work independently and as well as part of a team.
* Flexibility to work overtime and weekends as needed.

title: Shipping and Receiving Clerk
description:
Description:

Allstate Can, a division of The Ohio Art Company, is in need of a Shipping & Receiving Clerk. This position will require work on-site 4 days a week with overtime potential on weekends. (Mon-Thurs 6am-4:30pm)


Key Responsibilities:

* Receive incoming shipments of materials, verifying accuracy against purchase orders and shipping manifests.
* Unload trucks, containers or palettes, and inspect for any damage or discrepancies.
* Update inventory records to reflect received shipments and ensure accurate stock levels.
* Prepare outgoing shipments for delivery to customers by properly picking, packing, and labelling products correctly with shipping information and tracking numbers.
* Maintain accurate records of shipping and receiving information, including receipts, invoices, packing slips and other shipping documents.
* Communicate with internal team, suppliers, and logistics partners to coordinate efficient shipping and receiving activities, resolving any issues or discrepancies.
* Adhere to safety protocols and procedures to create a safe work environment for yourself and others.

**In addition to competitive compensation and growth potential, the benefit package includes:**

* Medical insurance
* Paid vacation
* 11 paid holidays
* I.A.M National Pension Fund


 Successful candidates must display a willingness to work overtime hours as needed and possess the ability to lift up to 50 pounds occasionally. Requirements:

 Requirements:

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Proven experience with shipping, receiving, and warehouse operations with at least 2-3 years experience or similar role.
* Knowledge of shipping and receiving procedures.
* Forklift certification or willingness to obtain certification.
* Attention to detail and accuracy in record-keeping and documentation.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Ability to work independently and as well as part of a team.
* Flexibility to work overtime and weekends as needed.

title: Lab Specimen Processor Plasma Donation Center
description:
This position is responsible for the processing of unit and sample processing, storage, shipment, and freezer management as required by Olgam Plasma Center location for biological product (human blood plasma). The Plasma Processor will ensure product and sample processing, and follow all federal, local, and organizational standards related to this determination. You will report directly into the Center Manager.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Manages the storage and organization of Biological product (human blood plasma) units and samples.
* Manages the preparation of sample shipment and product preparation for shipment.
* Reviews door records for completeness.
* Monitors freezer and refrigerator temperatures for compliance by accessing the inside of the freezers with temperatures up to -40 degrees.
* Maintain certification and annual re-certification requirements of the Olgam Life Training program.
* Attend all staff meetings and training sessions.
* Provides scheduling flexibility to ensure appropriate center support and coverage
* Ability to execute multi-step technical driven tasks
* Familiarization with electronic systems/platforms used to organize, track, and execute tasks
* Perform all duties and responsibilities of plasma processor.
* Monitor freezer performance, maintenance and documentation and reporting freezer excursions and temperature variance.
* Attend freezer alarms and move the cases of biological product (plasma) whenever required.
* Ensure concurrent, legible and accurate documentation.
* Maintain equipment and work area in a clean and organized manner and report all equipment in need of repair.
* Report all unsafe situations to supervisor immediately.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Educational Requirements:** 

· High school diploma or equivalent, college education preferred.

· Able to speak, read and legibly write English.

· Able to use computer.

**Physical Requirements:**

· Manual dexterity

· Ability to stand for long periods of time.

· Able to pull and lift up to 50 pounds.

· Able to spend periods of time in plasma freezers colder than -30°C.

· Ability to travel via automobile or public transportation.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $19.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Holidays
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

* lab: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Brooklyn, NY (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Brooklyn, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person
company_description: Olgam Life collects blood plasma in a caring, professional environment. We value our donors and make a real difference daily. Join us in saving lives.

title: Retention Specialist - Home Health Care
description:
**Edison Home Health Care -** is looking to hire a Retention Specialist. This position is focused on the eligibility aspect of patients, ensuring they remain eligible for home care services, correcting Medicaid issues, obtaining updated medicals, etc.

 *If you have a background in customer service, Medicaid, and healthcare? We want to hear from you!* **No prior experience needed!**

 **Responsibilities:**


* Managing a full schedule of calls all day with existing clients to have them retain their services with Edison Home Health Care.
* Follow up with patients for missing medicals.
* Follow up with patients who have Medicaid eligibility issues.
* Stay on top of the process to make sure they retain their services.
* Transferring qualified and converted callers to appropriate departments.
* Documenting all work in our database, maintaining a contact management strategy in Salesforce.
* Appropriately managing existing patients with various backgrounds across the state of New York.

  


**Requirements:**


* High school degree or equivalent - Required.
* Bilingual Spanish- Preferred.
* Comfort with Microsoft Office especially Excel and similar programs.
* Excellent verbal communication skills – including listening, comprehending, advising, and consulting.
* Strong organizational and time management skills
* Ability to work both independently and as a team.
* Highly self-motivated and results driven.
* Experience in home health care. - Plus
* Knowledge of HHA Exchange. - Plus

  


**Benefits:**



Direct Deposit Available



Health Insurance



Vision & Dental Insurance



401K



PTO Days/ Sick Days



6 Paid Federal Holidays + 2 Floating Holidays

  

#INDOP
company_description: Join the thousands of families across New York State who have chosen Edison Home Health Care for themselves and their loved ones.
